titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photographs by and relating to Allen Ginsberg MSS.PHOTO.0450
titlestmt.author: Cheryl McGrath

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-04-12 14:51:21 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Photographs by and relating to Allen Ginsberg
did.abstract: Photographs of and by poet Allen Ginsberg and colleagues.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Guide to the Allen Ginsberg Papers, 1937-1994 (M0733)
Allen Ginsberg film and video archive, 1983-1996 (Mss Media 0004)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection of roughly 88,000 photographs has been arranged into three principal series. Series 1 contains photographic prints and is further divided into the subseries: Ginsberg by Others (subseries 1.1), Photographs by Others (Subseries 1.2), Photographs of Friends (1.3) and Ginsberg Family Photographs (1.4). Series 2. Contact Sheets includes numbered contact prints which have been described the print level. Series 3. contains numbered negatives sheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Contains photographic prints, contact sheets and negatives of Ginsberg and his associates.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Irwin Allen Ginsberg was born on June 3, 1926 in Newark, New Jersey to Louis and Naomi (Levy) Ginsberg. American poet, author, lecturer, and teacher who was one of the core members of the Beat Generation of American author's in the 1950's and early 1960's along with Jack Kerouac, William S. Burroughs, and Neal Cassady. He died of complications of liver cancer on April 6, 1997.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Photographs by and relating to Allen Ginsberg, Mss Photo 450. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

did.physdesc: 20 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box (10.25 linear ft.)

Please note: this subseries does include some images of Ginsberg. Oversized prints have been removed and housed in flat boxes.

Golenpolsky; #4-6 Michael Sagatetian of Moscow Writers Union, Albertas Laurin Cuckas Ed Tiesa, Arthur Miller, Ivan Drach (Ukraine, poet, long hair) David Kogeltinov, Ghingiz Aitmatov, Jerry Lawrence, Alfonsis Maldonis (Chairman Lithuanian Writers Union) Norvel Young, Interpreter's rear, Nudai Federenko, right Lithuanian writers/observers, rear; #7-8 William Gaddis, Mezulaitis, Auchincloss; #9 same as 4-6 + Charles Fuller, left; #12-14 as 7-8 + Nicolas Slutskis (poet, Jewish); #15-19 Inge Morath and Arthur Miller, Hotel Dravgesta dining room, Vilius; #20-21 Norman Cousins and Federenko; #24 as above 4-6; 25 as above and Isabela Zorina Lithuanian writers/observers, rear; #26-28 observers: Helen Young, Mrs. Salisbury, interpreter Svetlova Makurenkova, Muriel Murphy, Adele Auchincloss, Morn Gass, ?, Inge Morath +?,; #30-31 folk group concluding sessions; 32 Vilnius centrum, Miller and Auchincloss"

Golenpolsky, Tanya Neyatrulofshaya interpreter, Michel Douskoy; interpreter, Nowell Young, Inge Morath camera, Arthur Miller and Jerry Lawrence seated back to camera (11-12) and Auchincloss; #13 same, Dimitri Urnoff, Mary Gass and William Gass from rear with above group; 14-21 Hatayn memorial cemetary to villages Nazis destroyed, outside of Minsk; 17-18 Inge Morath; 19 Adele Auchincloss? 20 Russians on the path; 22-27 "Great Patriotic War" Partisan Museum Muriel Murphy, Gass, Miller, Auchincloss, Tanya and guide Nil and Gelevich and Urnoff; 32 Norvel Young"

Monthly" Nov. 28, 1985 Oleg S. Vasiliev, Dept. Ed. Georgii P. Zlobin Editor Adele Auchincloss, of Western Fiction; 28 Norvel Young, Michael Douskoy, Jerry Lawrence, Bill Gass, William Gaddis; 31 Muriel Murphy and Isabella Zorina and Taterna Lavina Poetry Editor and Andrei Sergeiv with beard and glasses"
